Package model

Class CardTable

java.lang.Object
model.CardTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable
public class CardTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
Represents what in the physical game is the grid that holds all the development cards still available for players to buy

  • Constructor Details

    • CardTable

      public CardTable​(int id)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the last leader card

  • Method Details

    • buyTopCard

      public void buyTopCard​(CardColor cardColor, int level, PlayerBoard playerBoard, int cardSlot) throws SlotNotValidException, NotEnoughResourceException, EmptyDeckException
      Adds the selected card to the specified PlayerBoard in the specified slot
      Parameters:
      cardColor - specifies the column of the card in the grid
      level - specifies the level of the card to be bought (STARTS FROM 1)
      playerBoard - specifies which player is buying the card
      cardSlot - specifies in which production slot the player wants to put the card
      Throws:
      SlotNotValidException - if the selected card slot can not accept the selected card
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have the necessary resources to purchase the card
      EmptyDeckException - if there are no cards left of the selected color and level

    • discardTop

      public void discardTop​(CardColor cardColor) throws EmptyDeckException
      Removes from the grid the card of the specified color with the lowest level (this method should only be called only in solo mode)
      Parameters:
      cardColor - specifies the color of the card that has to be removed
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException - if there are no cards left of the selected color

    • checkAllColorsAvailable

      public boolean checkAllColorsAvailable()
      Checks if there is at least one card of each color still available (this method should only be called in solo mode)
      Returns:
      true if there's at least one card of each color still available

    • getCards

      public java.util.Map<CardColor,​java.util.List<java.util.List<DevelopmentCard>>> getCards()
      Getter
      Returns:
      the Map with all the cards in the CardTable

    • getTopCardId

      public int getTopCardId​(java.util.List<DevelopmentCard> deck)
      Gets the ID of the card on top of a specific deck of the CardTable
      Parameters:
      deck - of the card that u need
      Returns:
      the ID of the card on top of the specified deck

    • getDevelopmentCardFromId

      public DevelopmentCard getDevelopmentCardFromId​(int id) throws CardNotPresentException
      Getter
      Parameters:
      id - of the card to be returned
      Returns:
      the DevelopmentCard associated to the specified ID
      Throws:
      CardNotPresentException - when the given ID is not associated with any of the cards in the CardTable

    • restoreCards

      public void restoreCards​(java.util.Map<CardColor,​java.util.List<java.util.List<DevelopmentCard>>> cards)
      Restores the card table's decks
      Parameters:
      cards - the card table's DevelopmentCards, arranged in a Map of colors and Lists that act as decks
